Docs.summary: Responsible for layout of text stored in a object.

remarks.para: iOS 7 introduced "Text Kit," a broad set of APIs and modifications of existing classes, built on , that greatly expands the typographical flexibility of iOS.

The property holds a reference to a object, that holds a potentially large amount of styled text. The property holds an ordered array of objects in which it lays out text. The s, in turn, hold references to objects, which actually display the text.

Docs.summary: Whether layout can be done for a portion of the document without laying-out being recalculated from the beginning.

remarks.para: Setting this value to allows the to perform noncontiguous layout. In large documents, this can significantly increase performance, since the layout does not need to performed from the beginning of the document.
Application developers can use the EnsureLayout... methods with noncontiguous methods to confirm that particular portions of the text are being laid out properly.
